title: Ticket #3753: DMTCP checkpoint resumes must require original CheckpointPlatform
description:
To summarize the Condor-LIGO call discussion, Alan thinks the ideal fix is non-trivial, but Todd believes just adding a Chirp command to the shim script to edit the requirements would be an easy fix in the interim. LIGO is fine with that.

A poor workaround requiring user effort (and careful attention to pool composition) is to require a specific CheckpointPlatform at submit time.
remarks:
2013-Jul-11 16:34:14 by adesmet:
Chirp seems reasonable. The challenge is that step 1 of sending the chirp command is "find condor_chirp".

HTCondor doesn't provide any tools for finding it on the execute node, which could be a pain in the ass. Probably not the option I'd take. (See also: Ticket #3773: Put path to bin, sbin, libexec, and CONDOR_CONFIG in job's environment)

We can drag condor_chirp along with ourselves. This adds another detail to get right: we need to find it locally (an easier problem, and one we can punt to the end user), we need to add it to our transfer_input_files (easy), and we need to include all of the required HTCondor-specific libraries (16 as of 8.0.1 on RHEL6). A pain in butt, but probably the easier solution.

2013-Nov-22 14:08:35 by pfc:
Closing this for now; KVM checkpointing looks much more promising. Will reopen only if KVM checkpointing doesn't work out for some reason.
